string_table:
Professor, I just came back from the Dark Valley lab...
What?! What did you see there? Did you find anything?
Yes, a couple of dead bodies. They looked like your employees, judging by the suits. There was also some equipment down there. Take a look...
Eh... It's my fault... Well, give me what you've got. And here, a personal gift from me.
Greetings, professor.
Messer, you're alive! I can't believe it! Finally, we will be able to get deeper into the Zone! This is a dream come true! Take this, it's the proof of our gratitude.
Professor, I...
(Message from security): Attention, a giant horde of mutants is approaching the bunker! Boars, flesh and God knows what else! Hide, Professor!
I'm afraid you will need my help.
Dear God! Messer, please help our security! I'll have to seal the bunker.
Alright, I'll help you.
Professor, is everything alright?
Ooh... I think so. Where the hell did this horde? of mutants come from?
I think a controller brought them here, probably from the city.
Well, at least the horde was neutralized. Please, take this as your reward.
Professor, can you tell me something about the mutants of the Zone?
Which species do you want to know about? Also, I don't know of every species, so yeah.
Tell me about the controllers.
Tell me about the zombies.
Tell me about the burers. I hate burers.
Tell me about the pseudogiants.
Tell me about the pseudodogs, and regular dogs.
There are many theories about the origin of these mutants. The most popular theory is that they are the result of a failed experiment on the human brain. They're very dangerous, they can take control of almost anyone if they so much as look at them. Meeting a controller in an open space is an almost certain death.
There are many of them, especially here, at Yantar. They're walking shells of humans who underwent prolonged exposure to psi radiation. They're most dangerous in the first stage of degradation because they can carry and use weapons. In later stages they're just walking corpses.
Dwarves, we don't know anything about their upbringing, but it probably has something to do with experiments on controllers. They posses kinetic powers, which means that they can move objects from a distance without even touching them. Very dangerous creatures, they mostly inhabit underground areas due to their eyes hating light.
One of the most disgusting creatures of the Zone. They strike fear into even the most experienced of stalkers by their sheer size, their skin is extremely hard to break through even with rifle bullets. Dumb, giant and extremely aggressive.
During the Second Explosion, many animals, including dogs, were affected by extreme amounts of energy released by the blowouts. They mutated afterwards. Pseudodogs are usually leaders of packs of blind dogs. An encounter with a big group can be tragic. It is important to mention that some pseudodogs have also obtained psionic powers through some unknown means.
I'm not interested in that kind of information.
Thanks for the information.
I'd like to know more.
...
Here is your honorarium. Anything else?
No.
I've brought something.
What is it?
Magnet.
Strong gravitational artifact.
Double Shell.
Black Drops.
Electric Ball.
Mercury Ball.
Sponge.
Shell.
Death's Head.
Needles.
Sharp Needles.
I've changed my mind.
What do you do here?
We study the Zone from a scientific viewpoint. But I'm becoming more and more convinced, that studying it that way is impossible. But, perhaps you could help us by bringing us artifacts.
Are you looking for all kinds of artifacts?
No, we don't need common arts. We only need the rarer ones.
Ok, I'll try to bring some arts.
The container is in it's place.
Great. Was anyone there?
Yeah, there was one stalker. By the way, can you tell me about that village?
Workers of this very facility lived there, along with their families. I've heard that they all perished in the blink of an eye.
Yeah, I've heard that, too. Listen, do you know anything about the Journalist?
There goes a stalker by that name. He went missing a couple months ago looking for information about the Zone.
OK.
Once again, thanks for your help, Messer.
What is the job?
You need to drive a truck with a container to the village.
What truck?
The one at the base, obviously! It's waiting outside. Here, take the keys. Leave the truck and the container there.
Will someone be waiting for me there?
Yes, a stalker will be waiting for you there. We work closely with the usual stalkers, but this guy is snob. If does not want to communicate, you can contact him on PDA. Though it is optional, the main objective - to deliver freight into place.
Understood.
Just don't hit the gas too hard, Messer.
All the measurements are done, Professor.
Yes, I've already received the results.
What do we do now?
The entire thing is becoming clearer. There really is an underground complex beneath the lake, and something in that lab emits psi radiation. Based on the results, it appears that it is possible to reach that thing and turn it off. The thing is that all the entrances to the complex are blocked. That's why I've creating this sort of psi-blocking device which will reduce the amount of radiation you receive and will allow you to get into the lab.
So you want me to turn that thing off?
Exactly. Here's the psi-blocker. The entrance to the lab is located in the giant hangar at the complex. I don't have the exact coordinates of the control room, so you will have to find it yourself.
I'll do my best, doc.
Great. You're our best hope, Messer.
Greetings Professor, Barkeep sent me here. He said that you can help me get to the center of the Zone.
Good day, Messer. Yes, Barkeep and I talked about that. Theoretically, you can get to the center, but as we all know the road is blocked by psi radiation emitted by some unknown device.
Is there anything I can do to help?
We are located in one of the few science labs in the Zone, our goal is to study and better understand the Zone. There is an unknown psi-emitter located underground in this area. It's construction and mechanisms are very similar to the ones up north. If we could better know how it works, then we could develop psi-blockers allowing stalkers to get to the center of the Zone. Some time ago we started work on the blockers, many scientists in different regions of the Zone studied psionics and also worked on the blockers. Sadly, most of these men went missing, but their work should still be scattered around the Zone. From what I know they managed to make 2 psi-blocker prototypes. You need to bring them to me. The first one is in the lab under the Dark Valley. You'll find it in a locked room. The code to the locked door is 4678. The 2nd prototype is located in one of the apartments in the Shining Path, up north. You can get some more info from the Freedom leader, he and our colleagues worked together. We also need some sort of a gravitational contraption which has the ability of picking up and throwing things based on kinetic force. We don't have many information on that subject yet. You should search for that device at the Dark Valley lab, in the underground complex. The dwarves there have created some sort of sanctuary, and perhaps they know where you can find such a contraption.
OK, I'll get the prototypes.
I'm glad to hear that, Messer. Now be careful around here, the lake is filled with hotspots of radiation. You'll reach the Shining Path by a way behind one of the antennas to the north. Also, speak to the leader of Clear Sky, he should have some extra work for you.
I'll talk to him.
We'll decide what to do next later.
Good day Professor, I brought what you asked for.
Greetings, Messer. Great, give them to me and see what we can do with them.
Well, what do you say?
Interesting, interesting. Lots of useful stuff here. Sadly, the data here is encrypted. On top of that, you will need to measure the local psi-field.
Psi-field measurement? But I don't know how to make good measurements, especially of some psi-fields!
Yeah that's what I thought, that's why I ordered one of our men to help you do that. You'll need to protect him while he's doing the measurements. In front of our base is a car park, you'll meet him there. He should come from the direction of the grounded ark.
Alright, I'll do that right away.
A lot of mutant activity was reported around there lately, so keep extra cautious.
Are you the guy who's supposed to measure the fields?
Yes, that is me. The plan goes like this - we'll go towards the tower located near the village, then we'll go to the left side of the car park.
Alright.
Oh and by the way, stalkers arrived in that BTR. I guess the Professor managed to get some extra protection after all. Anyways, let's go.
Tell me, what kind of emissions happen around here?
We don't know their nature, we only know that they come from under the ground.
Interesting.
We have a theory that those emissions are caused by the psi-emitter located under the complex.
Hello, who are you?
I am the leader of the "Clear Sky" faction. We are kind of like stalkers-ecologs. We study the Zone and try to rid the world of this pain in the ass. We're neutral to other factions.
Alright. Do you work with the eggheads?
Yes. We are a small grouping and not many people share our beliefs.
You want to enter the scientist base? Alright, go through, just don't wave that gun of yours around.
I see that you've got yourself a security gig.
Well yeah, what about it? Work is work - nothing special, really.
Hm... just don't think that this place is always this calm...
Messer! You've made it! God damn, I don't know what to do now... The installtion is off... maybe it's time to go north?
Greetings. Yeah, it wasn't easy. You want to go north? How about we go together?
Sorry, but I'm going on a slightly different path. Maybe our paths will cross again! Once again, thank you for your work, Messer.
Best of luck to you.
Thank you... err... Messer, right? You helped save our associate Kruglov and in order to show my sincere appreciation I would like to present you with one of our working suits. It comes in very handy, you should know that... Could I be of additional help to you?
Yes, you just did to me and need. It is necessary to decipher some very important documents. I was advised to you.
Um ... Well, I'll help you, but only if you'll help us.
And how can I help?
We need information from Lab X16. Or, rather, information about the mechanism inside it that generates emissions which directly affects people's consciousness. I'm afraid I have to disappoint you: the place is impossible to penetrate without special psi-armor. The outcome is known in advance - even if you could evade the swarms of zombies that infest the laboratory entrance, you run the risk of becoming one of them. This is all very serious. However, we've designed a screening device to help shield the emission, but to fine-tune it we have to obtain additional measurements. If you help us with this task, we could probably provide you with a protective helm prototype.
I need to make measurements, and then in the laboratory to find information about this device. So?
Yes, that's right. We really need these data. Perhaps because of them can be eliminated or at least weaken the radiation. If you together with our staff will make all necessary measurements, I am prepared to work a prototype of the protective device and will give it to you. It is likely, will help to penetrate the laboratory.
Ok, I agree. But subject to an early summation of my information.
Of course, everything will be at its best. Talk to Kruglov and go. He has all the necessary gear.
OK.
Ok, I agree. But subject to an early summation of my information.
Of course, everything will be at its best. Talk with Semenov and go. Everything you need it already has.
OK.
No.. right now I don't want to sign up for this.
That's too bad, a real pity... I don't know how or when we could carry out this measurement expedition on our own.
;говноперевод
To hell with measurements! Tell me where the X-16, I will go and bring you the documents.
You do not understand, there is a very strong radiation. Toward a mile nobody could get close, it zombifies all without exception. It's now suicide to climb there without protection.
Hmm ... It changes everything.
Hmm ... It changes everything.
I do not care, just tell everything you know.
OK, but don't say I didn't warn you. Vasiliev worked on the laboratory problem. About a week ago, he and stalker by the name of Ghost attempted to get inside the laboratory. After several hours we felt a shake and emissions stopped; after another hour, we got a signal from Vasiliev, it was coming from the swamp but then vanished. By the looks of things, Vasiliev is gone. Try to find his body: he had accurate information about the laboratory - where it is and how to get in. He might have also known how to turn off the emissions. The laboratory entrance is most likely hidden in the basement of one of the buildings in the power plant area.
That's fine. Keep your documents.
Yes, Sir? What might you be looking for?
It is necessary to decipher some very important documents. Barkeep said that you can help.
Well, I'll help in this matter, but only if you help us.
Interesting. And how can I help?
;оригинал
Thank you, Messer, for rescuing Kruglov. Take this pressurized suit as a reward for your troubles. Also, I suspect you didn't come here for a simple reward, am I right?
I'm looking for Lab X16. The Barkeep told me that you might have info about its location.
We have been studying the emission in Lab X16 for a long time, but you won't get in there without special equipment. We've developed a psi-protection device that can help shield you from the emission, but needs some fine-tuning. If you could help us with that, I could give you a working prototype that you can use to get inside the laboratory.
OK.
Excellent, talk to Kruglov and get going. He's got everything you'll need.
No, I'm not up for this yet.
That's a real pity. So far we've been unable to send a measurement expedition of our own.
Yes, Sir? What might you be looking for?
Yes, we know about the laboratory. However, we don't know its exact coordinates.
Go on.
We have been studying the emission in Lab X16 for a long time, but you won't get in there without special equipment. We've developed a psi-protection device that can help shield you from the emission, but needs some fine-tuning. If you could help us with that, I could give you a working prototype that you can use to get inside the laboratory.
OK, I agree.
Excellent! Talk to Kruglov and get going. He is already equipped with the necessary gear.
OK.
OK, I agree.
Excellent! Talk to Semenov and get going. He's got everything you will need.
OK.
Screw measurements! Tell me where X-16 is, I'll go there myself..
You don't understand, there's an emitter. No one has been able to come closer than half a kilometer - it makes a zombie out of anyone. Going there without a suit is just like suicide, get it?
Hmm. That changes things.
Hmm. That changes things.
To hell with it, just tell me all you know.
OK, but don't say I didn't warn you. Vasiliev worked on the laboratory problem. About a week ago, he and stalker by the name of Ghost attempted to get inside the laboratory. After several hours we felt a shake and emissions stopped; after another hour, we got a signal from Vasiliev, it was coming from the swamp but then vanished. By the looks of things, Vasiliev is gone. Try to find his body: he had accurate information about the laboratory - where it is and how to get in. He might have also known how to turn off the emissions. The laboratory entrance is most likely hidden in the basement of one of the buildings in the power plant area.
There we go, great. Take the documents.
No.. right now I don't want to sign up for this.
That's too bad, a real pity... I don't know how or when we could carry out this measurement expedition on our own.
Thank you... mmm... Messer, right? You helped save our associate Kruglov and in order to show my sincere appreciation I would like to present you with one of our working suits. It comes in very handy, you should know that...
You did a splendid job, Messer! Now that the emissions are turned off, we will be able to order new expeditions and explore previously inaccessible territories. And also... from now on we will conduct a most favorable pricing policy toward you. \nКстати, я расшифровал те документы, которые Вы мне передали. В них содержится очень интересная информация. Вот, держите расшифровку, тут всё подробно изложено.
Thank you.
Yes, Messer? What are you looking for?
Yes, Messer? Did you want something?
You did an excellent job. If the measurements are correct, the prototype should provide you with maximum protection from emission.
Glad to hear that.
Now your path to the laboratory is clear... except that if the source of the emission isn't destroyed and doesn't lose its power, you may not have enough time to get back. So, my dear Sir, here is the deal. Our calculations have produced an estimated location of the source as well as the fact that it is under ground. With your permission, I have already marked the spot on your map.
How exactly does one get inside Lab X16? Where is the entrance?
Vasiliev was working on the lab issue. About a week ago he and a stalker called Ghost tried to get inside. A couple of hours later we felt a major tremor, and after another hour we picked up a signal from Vasiliev coming from the swamp, but it died away. And Vasiliev died away with it, it would seem. Try to find his corpse. He had the exact information on the lab and the way to get into it. There may even be info on deactivating that source of the emission. I've uploaded you all the data we have.
Ahem...It would be very interesting to take a look at these documents. So, you think Vasiliev has them?
Perhaps. At any rate, you must start by finding Vasiliev's body - that is the only chance of obtaining accurate information about the lab's location. The body of your colleague, Ghost, must be somewhere there as well. You know, it seemed to me like he knew a lot more about X16 than he admitted to us. Had he somehow survived... Well, it's no use holding on to that hope, of course.
OK, I'll try. Take the documents.
Why did he die? You were supposed to protect him!
Kruglov got killed by the zombies... I couldn't help it, there were too many of them.
Oh, man...how could this happen? How could this happen??! Damn it, everything is going wrong again. Now we'll have to call for more people... We've got enough problems as it is... Damn...
Listen... Kruglov is gone, but I'm alive. Give me the prototype. I will fight my way inside X16.
Here is a prototype, be careful with it. It's not calibrated properly, but that's your fault - you failed to save our colleague. The device won't provide maximum protection, but at least it will lower the emission's intensity. So, stalker, you'll have to move fast on your way to the source.
How does one get inside Lab X16? Where exactly is the entrance?
Vasiliev was working on the lab issue. About a week ago he and a stalker called Ghost tried to get inside. A couple of hours later we felt a major tremor, and after another hour we picked up a signal from Vasiliev coming from the swamp, but it died away. And Vasiliev died away with it, it would seem. Try to find his corpse. He had the exact information on the lab and the way to get into it. There may even be info on deactivating that source of the emission. I've uploaded you all the data we have.
Anything else?
You must start by finding Vasiliev's body - that is the only chance of obtaining accurate information about the lab's location. The body of your colleague, Ghost, must be somewhere there as well. You know, it seemed to me like he knew a lot more about X16 than he admitted to us. If he has survived somehow... Well, it's no use holding on to that hope, of course.
OK, I'll try. Take the documents.
Why did he die? Weren't you supposed to protect him?!
Semenov got shot by the zombies... I couldn't help it, there were too many of them.
Oh, man...how could this happen? How could this happen??! Damn it, everything is going wrong again. Now we'll have to call for more people... We've got enough problems as it is... Damn...
Listen... Semenov is gone, but I'm alive. Give me the prototype. I will fight my way inside X16.
Here is a prototype, be careful with it. It's not calibrated properly, but that's your fault - you failed to save our colleague. The device won't provide maximum protection, but at least it will lower the emission's intensity. So, stalker, you'll have to move fast on your way to the source.
How does one get inside Lab X16? Where exactly is the entrance?
Vasiliev was working on the lab issue. About a week ago he and a stalker called Ghost tried to get inside. A couple of hours later we felt a major tremor, and after another hour we picked up a signal from Vasiliev coming from the swamp, but it died away. And Vasiliev died away with it, it would seem. Try to find his corpse. He had the exact information on the lab and the way to get into it. There may even be info on deactivating that source of the emission. I've uploaded you all the data we have.
Ahem...It would be very interesting to take a look at these documents. So, you think Vasiliev has them?
Perhaps. At any rate, you must start by finding Vasiliev's body - that is the only chance of obtaining accurate information about the lab's location. The body of your colleague, Ghost, must be somewhere there as well. You know, it seemed to me like he knew a lot more about X16 than he admitted to us. Had he somehow survived... Well, it's no use holding on to that hope, of course.
OK, I'll try. Take the documents.
Yes, Messer?
Yes, Messer?
It's too bad that Kruglov died... Alas, nothing can bring him back. It's most important that you bring us the measurement data. Did you?
Yeah. Here.
Ok, let me adjust the prototype. Wait for me here.
Gotcha.
No.
Then get them, and quick! I cannot calibrate the prototype properly without them.
You did an excellent job. If the measurements are correct, the prototype should provide you with maximum protection from emission.
Can you be a little more clear?
Stalker, now you will be able to break through to the laboratory, but unless you turn off the emitter, you won't last long even with the psi-protection on. We've estimated an approximate location of the emitter; it is located in an underground facility. I have marked the spot on your map.
How do I get inside X16? Where exactly is the entrance?
Vasiliev was working on the lab issue. About a week ago he and a stalker called Ghost tried to get inside. A couple of hours later we felt a major tremor, and after another hour we picked up a signal from Vasiliev coming from the swamp, but it died away. And Vasiliev died away with it, it would seem. Try to find his corpse. He had the exact information on the lab and the way to get into it. There may even be info on deactivating that source of the emission. I've uploaded you all the data we have.
Ahem...It would be very interesting to take a look at these documents. So, you think Vasiliev has them?
Perhaps. At any rate, you must start by finding Vasiliev's body - that is the only chance of obtaining accurate information about the lab's location. The body of your colleague, Ghost, must be somewhere there as well. You know, it seemed to me like he knew a lot more about X16 than he admitted to us. Had he somehow survived... Well, it's no use holding on to that hope, of course.
OK, I'll try. Take the documents.
Professor, are you by any chance interested in the map of the Shining Path?
Of course I am. I'll pay you 15000RU.
OK, here is your map.
Maybe another time.
There's no time...
Yes, Messer?
The professor asked me to take a trip to the measurement site.
Now you're talking business! Let's move out immediately. It was no use getting there alone, but with you it's different... I think we'll manage quickly - just make sure not to let those cadavers get too close. So, you ready?
Yeah.
You know what... Why don't you go first. You've got a whole lot of experience, unlike me. And those cadavers are starting to move again...
OK.
Wow! Messer here on a personal visit! Finally you've made it to our parts. Talk to the Professor - he wants to thank you for rescuing me.
Later, later!
Hey, Messer! How are things going?
Yes, Messer?
Professor asked me to take a trip to the measurement site.
Now you're talking business! Let's move out immediately. It was no use getting there alone, but with you it's different... I think we'll manage quickly - just make sure not to let those cadavers too close to you. So, you ready?
Yeah.
You know what... Why don't you go first. You've got a whole lot of experience, unlike me. And those cadavers are starting to move again...
OK.
I'm sorry, I have no time for this right now.
Hey, Messer! How's life?
Wait a little bit... We need to finish talking.
Wait! I'm not done taking measurements!
Yipe!. Ouch... argh..
You alive? C'mon, get up... Get up slowly. It's all over. It's behind us now.
Hey, Messer. How are you?
Done! Pack the camera, time to get going!
Hey, Messer! How's life?
